it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.model.board

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.common.observer.Observable<ModelUpdate>
      • it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.model.board.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observer<ModelUpdate>, RemoteObserver<ModelUpdate>, Remote

    public class Board
extends Observable<ModelUpdate>
implements Observer<ModelUpdate>
    This class represents the game board.

    It holds the squares, the rooms in which the squares are organised and the locations of the various spawn points (one for each powerup color).

    By convention the square with coordinate (0,0) is in the upper-left corner; square (1,0) is immediately at its right, while square (0,1) is immediately beneath it.

    The class also provides various methods to navigate the board from a starting point with various constraints (distance, movement direction, etc.)

    Author:
    Alessandro Fulgini, Lorenzo Farinelli, Tiziano Fucci

      • getVisibleSquares

        public Set<Square> getVisibleSquares(Square start)

      • visitNeighbors

        public Set<Square> visitNeighbors(Square start,
                                  Set<Square> alreadyVisited,
                                  Predicate<Map.Entry<CardinalDirection,SquareConnection>> directionFilter,
                                  Predicate<SquareConnection> connectionFilter,
                                  Integer maxSteps)
        Performs a width-first recursive visit of the neighbouring squares starting from start, with the possibility of setting a constrained direction, the type of navigable connections and the maximum number of steps. The visit stops when the maximum number of steps is reached or when the visitable neighbors are already in alreadyVisited
        Parameters:
        start - The square from which to start the navigation, not null
        alreadyVisited - The set of already visited squares, not null, will be modified
        directionFilter - A predicate which constraints the visit to a certain direction, not null
        connectionFilter - A predicate which filters SquareConnectionType, this will be applied to determine which adjacent squares can be visited
        maxSteps - the maximum number of steps after which the visit ends (if 0 will only add start, if negative it will not add nothing), optional
        Returns:
        A set with the visited squares, including the ones already visited
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If start, alreadyVisited or connectionFilter are null

      • querySquares

        public Set<Square> querySquares(Square start,
                                VisibilityEnum visibility,
                                CardinalDirection direction,
                                Integer minDist,
                                Integer maxDist)
        Given a starting square, this method navigates the board and returns the set of visited squares matching the specified filters
        Parameters:
        start - the square from which start, not null
        visibility - determines on which condition you can move from a square to its adjacent
        direction - the visit will proceed only in this direction, optional
        minDist - the minimum amount of moves from the starting square, optional
        maxDist - the maximum amount of moves from the starting square, optional
        Returns:
        the set of visited squares matching the specified filters
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if distances are negative or minDist > maxDist
        NullPointerException - if start or visibility are null

      • calculateAlignedDirection

        public static CardinalDirection calculateAlignedDirection(CoordPair a,
                                                          CoordPair b)
        Given two locations, determines if they are aligned and returns the cardinal direction of b from a. If the locations coincide or if they are not aligned returns null.
        Parameters:
        a - The starting location, not null
        b - The end location, not null
        Returns:
        The cardinal direction from a to b, null if it can't be determined
